description.zh-cn: 明宣宗朱瞻基的原配皇后，后被废为道姑，号静慈仙师。天顺年间被明英宗追复皇后位，谥号恭让诚顺康穆静慈章皇后。
description.en: The first empress of the Xuande Emperor of the Ming Dynasty. She was later deposed and became a Taoist nun with the title 'Jingci Xianshi'. Her title of empress was posthumously restored during the Tianshun era by Emperor Yingzong.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第五位皇帝，胡善祥的丈夫，后废黜胡善祥并改立孙贵妃为皇后。
description.en: The fifth emperor of the Ming Dynasty, husband of Hu Shanxiang. He later deposed her and made Consort Sun the new empress.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗的第二任皇后，原为贵妃，在生下明英宗后取代胡善祥成为皇后。
description.en: The second empress of the Xuande Emperor. Originally a consort, she replaced Hu Shanxiang as empress after giving birth to Emperor Yingzong.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥之父，任锦衣卫指挥。
description.en: Father of Hu Shanxiang, served as a commander in the Jinyiwei (Embroidered Uniform Guard).

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥之母。
description.en: Mother of Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗与胡善祥所生长女。
description.en: The eldest daughter of the Xuande Emperor and Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗与胡善祥所生次女。
description.en: The second daughter of the Xuande Emperor and Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥之姊，明太祖时的尚宫。
description.en: Sister of Hu Shanxiang, served as a Shang Gong (Lady of the Palace) during the reign of Emperor Taizu of Ming.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥之兄。
description.en: Brother of Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥之弟。
description.en: Brother of Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗长子，由孙贵妃所生（一说收养）。明朝第六位皇帝，后为胡善祥追复皇后位。
description.en: The eldest son of the Xuande Emperor, born to Consort Sun (or adopted). The sixth emperor of the Ming Dynasty, who later posthumously restored the title of empress to Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗之母，明仁宗的皇后。她怜悯胡善祥被废，在其生前多加照顾。
description.en: Mother of the Xuande Emperor and empress of the Hongxi Emperor. She sympathized with the deposed Hu Shanxiang and took care of her.

description.zh-cn: 明英宗的皇后，向明英宗请求为胡善祥复位。
description.en: Empress of Emperor Yingzong of Ming, who requested the emperor to restore Hu Shanxiang's title.

description.zh-cn: 明朝大学士，支持明英宗为胡善祥恢复皇后名位。
description.en: A Grand Secretary of the Ming Dynasty who supported Emperor Yingzong in restoring the title of empress to Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 顺德公主的丈夫。
description.en: Husband of Princess Shunde.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗的妃嫔。
description.en: A consort of the Xuande Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第四位皇帝，明宣宗之父。
description.en: The fourth emperor of the Ming Dynasty, father of the Xuande Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥的出身地。
description.en: The birthplace of Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥的安葬地。
description.en: The burial place of Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗以胡善祥“无子多病”为由废黜其皇后之位的事件。
description.en: The event in which the Xuande Emperor deposed Empress Hu Shanxiang on the grounds that she was 'childless and sickly'.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代皇太孙正配的称号。
description.en: The title for the primary consort of an Imperial Grandson in ancient China.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代皇太子正配的称号。
description.en: The title for the primary consort of a Crown Prince in ancient China.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代君主正配的称号。
description.en: The title for the primary consort of a monarch in ancient China.

description.zh-cn: 明朝设立的军政搜集情报机构。
description.en: The military and intelligence agency of the Ming Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代宫廷女官职位。
description.en: A position for a female official in the imperial court of ancient China.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥于1417年被选为皇太孙妃，1425年被立为皇后，1428年被废。
description.en: Hu Shanxiang was selected as the Grand Consort of the Imperial Grandson in 1417, became Empress in 1425, and was deposed in 1428.

description.zh-cn: 孙氏原为贵妃，1428年被册立为皇后，取代了胡善祥。
description.en: Lady Sun was originally a consort and was made Empress in 1428, replacing Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 吴贤妃是明宣宗的侧室。
description.en: Consort Wu was a concubine of the Xuande Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 顺德公主嫁给了石璟。
description.en: Princess Shunde was married to Shi Jing.

description.zh-cn: 钱皇后是明英宗的皇后。
description.en: Empress Qian was the empress of Emperor Yingzong.

description.zh-cn: 张氏是明仁宗的皇后。
description.en: Lady Zhang was the empress of the Hongxi Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 孙贵妃生下宣宗长子明英宗，但也有说法指是收养宫女之子。
description.en: Consort Sun gave birth to the Xuande Emperor's eldest son, Emperor Yingzong, though some sources claim he was the adopted son of a palace maid.

description.zh-cn: 胡善围是胡善祥的姊姊。
description.en: Hu Shanwei was Hu Shanxiang's older sister.

description.zh-cn: 胡安是胡善祥的兄长。
description.en: Hu An was Hu Shanxiang's older brother.

description.zh-cn: 胡瑄是胡善祥的弟弟。
description.en: Hu Xuan was Hu Shanxiang's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 以胡皇后“无子多病”为由，命令胡皇后上表辞位。
description.en: Citing Empress Hu's 'childlessness and illness', he ordered her to submit a letter of resignation.

description.zh-cn: 孙贵妃生下宣宗长子明英宗，为宣宗废黜胡善祥提供了借口。
description.en: Consort Sun giving birth to the Xuande Emperor's eldest son, Emperor Yingzong, provided a pretext for the emperor to depose Empress Hu.

description.zh-cn: 在宣宗废后事件中，胡善祥被废黜皇后之位，退居长安宫修道，成为静慈仙师。
description.en: During the event of the emperor's deposition of the empress, Hu Shanxiang was stripped of her title, retired to Chang'an Palace to practice Taoism, and became Jingci Xianshi.

description.zh-cn: 怜悯贤德的胡氏，常召其居住清宁宫，并在内廷朝宴时将其座席安排在孙皇后之上。
description.en: She sympathized with the virtuous Hu, often inviting her to live in Qingning Palace and arranging her seat above Empress Sun during court banquets.

description.zh-cn: 为胡善祥追上尊谥“恭让诚顺康穆静慈章皇后”，并修陵寝，恢复其皇后名分。
description.en: Posthumously honored Hu Shanxiang with the title 'Empress Gongrang Chengshun Kangmu Jingci Zhang', restored her tomb, and reinstated her status as empress.

description.zh-cn: 向明英宗为胡善祥请命，请求恢复其皇后位份。
description.en: She petitioned Emperor Yingzong on behalf of Hu Shanxiang, requesting the restoration of her title as empress.

description.zh-cn: 支持明英宗恢复胡善祥的皇后名位，并建议按制度为其修陵寝、享殿、神主。
description.en: He supported Emperor Yingzong in restoring Hu Shanxiang's title of empress and advised that her mausoleum, memorial hall, and spirit tablet be built according to protocol.

position.en: Grand Consort of the Imperial Grandson
